com.github.arham4.turtle

Class Turtle

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.arham4.turtle.Turtle

  • public final class Turtle
extends java.lang.Object
    A Turtle entity. A turtle is essentially a character that can be manipulated to perform actions on a screen, such as movement and changes in its appearance.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Turtle()
      Creates a turtle with the TurtleShape.CLASSIC shape and a speed of 3.

    • Method Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • Turtle

        public Turtle()
        Creates a turtle with the TurtleShape.CLASSIC shape and a speed of 3.

    • Method Detail

      • shape

        public void shape(java.lang.String name)
        Changes the shape of the turtle by looking at the location specified (starting from the project root). Shapes are not required to use an addShape function. A shape specified in TurtleShape may be used. If a shape's name is specified that is not in the TurtleShape class, the shape will load from an image file.
        Parameters:
        name - The complete name of the "shape," including its file extension.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the File is not found.
        See Also:
        TurtleShape

      • shape

        public void shape(TurtleShape shape)
        Sets the shape of the turtle using the appropriate TurtleShape constant. A full list of default shapes can be found at TurtleShape.
        Parameters:
        shape - The TurtleShape to set it to.
        See Also:
        TurtleShape

      • shape

        public void shape(java.awt.image.BufferedImage bufferedImage)
        Due to the power of the ImageIO class, this helper method is made so one can load a BufferedImage for the turtle to embody as its shape through custom methods.
        Parameters:
        bufferedImage - The BufferedImage to set the turtle to.
        See Also:
        ImageIO.read(URL), ImageIO.read(File), ImageIO.read(InputStream), ImageIO.read(ImageInputStream)

      • color

        public void color(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the color of the turtle and the line it draws using the name of the color. A full list of colors can be found at TurtleColor. If the color is invalid, the turtle will turn black.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the color.
        See Also:
        TurtleColor

      • color

        public void color(TurtleColor color)
        Sets the color of the turtle and the line it draws using the appropriate TurtleColor constant. A full list of colors can be found at TurtleColor.
        Parameters:
        color - The TurtleColor to set it to.
        See Also:
        TurtleColor

      • color

        public void color(java.awt.Color color)
        Sets the color of the turtle and the line it draws.
        Parameters:
        color - The new Color to set the turtle and line colors to.

      • goTo

        public void goTo(double x,
                 double y)
        Makes a turtle go to a certain coordinate point.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate for the turtle to go to.
        y - THe y-coordinate for the turtle to go to.

      • forward

        public void forward(double amount)
        Makes a turtle move forward with respect to its current angle that it is facing.
        Parameters:
        amount - The distance for the turtle to move. This number is taken and then multiplied with the cosine of the angle at which the turtle is currently facing for the x distance and done the same for the y-position, using sine instead.

      • right

        public void right(double angle)
        Turns a turtle right.
        Parameters:
        angle - The angle at which to turn the turtle.

      • left

        public void left(double angle)
        Turns a turtle left.
        Parameters:
        angle - The angle at which to turn the turtle.

      • speed

        public void speed(double speed)
        Sets the speed value to a new speed.
        Parameters:
        speed - The new speed at which to draw with the turtle.

      • getShape

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getShape()
        Gets the raw image of the current "shape" being represented by the turtle.
        Returns:
        The raw image of the current shape.

      • getX

        public double getX()
        The current x-coordinate of the center of the Turtle.
        Returns:
        The current x-coordinate of the Turtle.

      • getY

        public double getY()
        The current y-coordinate of the center of the Turtle.
        Returns:
        The current y-coordinate of the Turtle.

      • getAngle

        public double getAngle()
        Gets the angle the Turtle is facing. It is possible for the angle to be greater than or equal to 360 and less than or equal to 0.
        Returns:
        Gets the angle the Turtle is facing.

      • getColor

        public java.awt.Color getColor()
        The color of the Turtle.
        Returns:
        The color of the Turtle.
